Sweden

Group F | Europe

Meatballs

The top three things that come to mind when you think about Sweden are probably meatballs, Ikea and Zlatan, in that order. Although he would say he transcends all, even the World Cup, which he won't be at this year.

These meatballs from Dinner Then Dessert are already pretty close to perfect, but top them off with a dollop of lingonberry jam, and you're in business. Note to readers – this was done well before meatball-gate revealed the true source of these delicious morsels to be Turkey, and they were just too good to replace.

  • Time 2hrs
    plus freezing meetballs
  • Makes 6
  • Difficulty Professional
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 3 slices White bread
    3 slices
    3 slices
    White bread crust removed
  • 80ml Milk
    1/3 cup
    80ml
    Milk
  • 112g Butter
    8 tbsp 7 tbsp 5 tbsp 4 tbsp
    112g 98g 70g 56g
    Butter
  • 1 Onion
    1
    1
    Onion diced
  • 450g Ground beef
    1lb
    450g
    Ground beef
  • 450g Ground pork
    1lb
    450g
    Ground pork
  • 2 Eggs
    2
    2
    Eggs
  • &frac12; tsp Ground allspice
    ½ tsp
    ½ tsp
    Ground allspice
  • &frac14; tsp Nutmeg
    ¼ tsp
    ¼ tsp
    Nutmeg grated
  • 30g Flour
    ¼ cup
    30g
    Flour
  • 1l Beef stock
    4 cups
    1l
    Beef stock
  • 1 tbsp Soy sauce
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Soy sauce
  • 120ml Heavy cream
    ½ cup
    120ml
    Heavy cream
  • &frac14; tsp White pepper
    ¼ tsp
    ¼ tsp
    White pepper
  • 2 tbsp Lingonberry jam
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Lingonberry jam
  • few springs Parsley
    few springs
    few springs
    Parsley
  • 1
    In a large bowl soak the bread in the milk.
    Coach's tip A mixer will give the meatballs a smoother texture and keep them colder.
    Coach's tip A mixer will give the meatballs a smoother texture and keep them colder.
  • 2
    While the bread soaks, melt 1 tbsp14g of butter in a frying pan and cook the onion until transclucent, but not brown. When finished remove from heat and cool.
  • 3
    In the bowl with the bread and milk, add the ground beef, ground pork, 2 tbsp28g of butter, 2 eggs, cooked onions, the allspice and nutmeg. Season with salt & pepper. Using a mixer on a low speed, or your hands, combine until all ingredients are distributed equally.
  • 4
    To shape the meatballs, take 2 tbsp of the mixture at a time, and roll into a even, round ball. Continue until all mixture has been used. Freeze the meatballs for at least 15 minutes – this ensures they will keep their shape when you cook them.
  • 5
    When meatballs are ready, heat 1 tbsp14g of butter on a medium setting in a large dutch oven. Cook meatballs 4-5 at a time, evenly browning all sides. Once brown, remove and set aside. Scrape the bottom of the dutch oven with a wooden spoon to release any burnt bits and discard.
  • 6
    Melt the rest of the butter in the dutch oven. Add the flour and whisk until combined. Add the beef stock and stir until flour mixture has combined with the liquid.
  • 7
    Add the soy sauce, heavy cream, white pepper and stir. Return the meatballs to the pot and simmer until gravy has thickened and the meatballs have cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
  • 8
    If desired, top with parsley and a dollop of lingonberry jam.
